qas.question: Economist Paul Krugman explained the credit crisis via the implosion of which system?
What is the system with nearly equal the importance of traditional commercial banking?
The shadow banking system could not provide funds to mortgage firms and other corporations without the ability to obtain which funds?
What was Timothy Geithner's position during the fall of 2008?

context: Economist Paul Krugman and <a3_0>U.S. Treasury Secretary<a3_0/> Timothy Geithner explain the credit crisis via the implosion of the <a0_0><a1_0>shadow banking system<a1_0/><a0_0/>, which had grown to nearly equal the importance of the traditional commercial banking sector as described above. Without the ability to obtain <a2_0>investor funds<a2_0/> in exchange for most types of mortgage-backed securities or asset-backed commercial paper, investment banks and other entities in the shadow banking system could not provide funds to mortgage firms and other corporations.
